info.description:
**Guidelines:**

* Parameters: camelCase, starting with lowercase
* Data types and their Attributes: CamelCase, starting with uppercase
* General rule: Response (object) determines endpoint: If reponse is Account, the endpoint should start with "/accounts". In cases where this may be up for discussion, multiple endpoints may be available for some time in order to evaluate.

**Standards:**

APIs should use ISO and RFC standards. 

* Country: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2, eg "NO", "US", "GB": https://www.iso.org/standard/63546.html
* Currency: ISO 4217: alpha 3-letter upcase e.g “NOK", "EUR”, "USD": https://www.iso.org/iso-4217-currency-codes.html
* Date: ISO 8601, eg "2017-11-02" (day) and "2017-11-02T14:09:15+00:00" (timestamp):  www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm
* SWIFT BIC: ISO 9362: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_9362
* IBAN ISO 13616:2007: https://www.iso.org/standard/41031.html
* MCC: ISO 18245: https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html (https://github.com/greggles/mcc-codes)

**HTTP Response Codes**

HTTP reponse codes in Open Bank may be more detailed than in Shared Sertvices and layers below. The HTTP reponses below is a good starting point, and may be updated if needed. 

Success

* 200: OK, https://httpstatuses.com/200 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.1     
* 201: Created, https://httpstatuses.com/201 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.3.2

Client Error

* 400: Bad Request, https://httpstatuses.com/400 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.1     
* 401: Unauthorized, https://httpstatuses.com/401 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235#section-3.1      
* 403: Forbidden, https://httpstatuses.com/403 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.3     
* 404: Not Found, https://httpstatuses.com/404 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.5.4      
* 429: Too Many Requests, https://httpstatuses.com/429 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6585#section-4   

Server Error

* 500: Server Error, https://httpstatuses.com/500 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.6.1     
* 503: Service Unavailable, https://httpstatuses.com/503 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.6.4
* 504: Timeout, https://httpstatuses.com/504 / https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-6.6.5     

**Github**

https://github.com/cloveras/dnb/
info.title: 7580: APIs for Third Parties - gateway layer

get.summary: Get all accounts for current user

get.description:
Optional query parameters below. Note: Sorting and filtering affects backend, and may change.

* SortOrder: "ASC", "DESC"
* DateFrom: "YYYY-MM-DD": ISO 8601: www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm
* DateTo: "YYYY-MM-DD": ISO 8601: www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm
* AmountMinimum: Include amount from (and including) this amount.
* AmountMaximum: Include amount from (and including) this amount.
* MCC: Include only this MCC code: ISO 18245: https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html 
* FreeText: Filter by free text
* IncludePending: **TODO:** Determine if this should be included, or refer to /payments/due/{accountNumber}

get.summary: Get due payments for account by date range
Get details for a payment for an account

get.description: List over customers debet and credit cards
Includes balance and credit limit (when applicable).

patch.description: Aviability for end-customet to block a debit or credit card. (Not Cresco Cards)

get.description: Get card invoice form chosen month

post.description:
Domestic payment with KID or message.

Returns HTTP 201 and the ```PaymentId``` of successfully created payment.

schema.description: Returning id of the new payment

get.summary: Get due payments by date range
get.description: Gets all due payments, both domestic and international.

get.summary: Get due payment by payment id
get.description:
Returns Payment, complete with with PaymentDetails.

This endpoint may change, as it is offers the same as “/accounts/{accountNumber}/payments/due/{paymentId}”, and the placement is not decided yet.

patch.description:
A payment can be updatet until due dtae. 
Possible to udate :
* Date ("YYYY-MM-DD", ISO 8601: www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/iso8601.htm)
* Amount
* Status (deactivate, reactivate)

Returns the updated Payment.

get.summary: Convert amount from CUR1 to CUR2
get.description: Quite basic for now. Input welcome.

get.summary: Get a list rates for the most common currencies, with a specified base

get.description: Base geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: For now: Assume geocoding functionality similar to Google Maps: https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/geocoding/intro

get.description: Opening times is also included in Branch.
If no details (as for now): Assume ATM is open 24h.

get.summary: Get list of all DNB branches

FirstName.description: First name. May be used contact person if type is ```COMPANY```.

LastName.description: Surname. May be used contact person if type is ```COMPANY```.

Phone.description: Including "+" and international prefix. Whitespace is stripped.

Customer.description:
One common ```Customer```data object for all kinds of customers.

Some updates required. See https://shasl.restlet.io/#type_customer

Also: Align with CIM, while still hiding internal complexity and making it easy to unserstand and use.

CustomerEngagement.description:
Used with ```Customer```. 

Work in progress. See https://shasl.restlet.io/#type_engagement

AccountNumber.description: 11 digits. Bank, etc can be determined from this: https://no.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kontonummer

Account.description:
A small test of embedded code:
```
{
  "AccountNumber": "string",
  "Type": "string",
  "AccountName": "string",
  "BalanceAvailable": "number",
  "AccountOwner": "string",
  "AccountDetails": {
    "AccountNumber": "string",
    "IBAN": "string",
    "BIC": "string",
    "Currency": "string",
    "Created": "string (date-time)",
    "Updated": "string (date-time)",
    "AccountInterestDetails": {
      "AccountNumber": "string",
      "InterestRate": "number",
      "EarnedInterestToDate": "number",
      "AccruedInterestAndFeesToDate": "number",
      "FeesToDate": "string",
      "AccruedInterestFromLastYear": "number"
    }
  }
}
```

AccountDetails.description: Details for an ```Account```, with optional reference to ```AccountDetails```.

MaskedCardNumber.description: 16 characters: Twelve "X", and the last four digits ofr the card number. 4x4 nubers with whitespace.

AccountNumber.description: Both for debit and credit cards

MaskedCardNumber.description: 16 characters: Twelve “X”, and the last four digits ofr the card number. 4x4 nubers with whitespace.

Payment.description:
Details about a payment. Used by:
* /payments/due/{accountNumber}: Returning a list of payments, with _empty_ PaymentDetails
* /payments/due/{accountNumber}/details: Returning a list of payments, with PaymentDetails

```
{
  "PaymentId": "string",
  "DebitAccount": "string",
  "CreditAccount": "string",
  "Amount": "string",
  "Type": "string",
  "Date": "string (date)",
  "Status": "string",
  "PaymentDetails": {
    "InvoiceReference": "string"
  }
}
```

PaymentDetails.description: More details about a payment. Some payment types have more data than others.

Message.description: Used for both KID and Message, based on Type.

PaymentInitiation.description:
Three types of payments
* KID: Customer Identification (2-25 digits, including control digit)
* Message: Text message describing the payment

Not including the "straksbetaling" (imediate payment) flag, as this will be the default.

Payment initiator: Part of the contxt object, but kept here too for reference.

currency.description: If not the currency of the account/card.

MCC.description: MCC: Number and "combined description". ISO 18245: https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html

Transaction.description:
Same ```Transaction``` for ll types of transactions: Account transactions, card transactions, etc. Some transaction types have more fields and data than others. A developer should not need to know about different transaction types when retrieving them.

MCC codes: https://github.com/greggles/mcc-codes Example for hotels:
```
  {
    "mcc": "3514",
    "edited_description": "Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts",
    "combined_description": "Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts",
    "usda_description": "",
    "irs_description": "Hotels/Motels/Inns/Resorts",
    "irs_reportable": "Yes",
    "id": 418
}
```

Address.description: Corresponds with address fields used internally in DNB.

description.description: May be used for large areas like airports, train stations, stadiums, etc.

Location.description: Data object for physical location based on GPS coordinates. May be used for something that needs a more specific than an address provides, such as an ATM at a train station. A Location may be used in addition to an Address.

OpeningTimes.description:
Opening times for a branch, ATM, or something else.

If open 24 hours, use "00:00" both for OpeningTime and CloseTime.

errorDocumentation.description: URI to developer documentation for this error

errorDetails.description: Details about the cause of this error. Zero or more.

error.description:
The HTTP error response code is the main classifier. A DNB-specific ```errorNumber```is also provided as a lookup reference. The ```explanation```is a descriptive, human-readable text. 

May have zero or more ```errorDetails```.

errorField.description: Name of field that caused the error.

errorDescription.example: First name cannot have non-Latin characters.

errorDetails.description: Detailed explanation of the error. Used by ```error```.
